MTIStitch1: ^Mother Tree: Child, can you hear me?
MTIStitch2: ^Mother Tree: You are both a listener and a singer, rarities in this cosm of a once swirling, chattering underground. Most are now voiceless and unable to hear each other.
MTIStitch3: ^Mother Tree: I am the Mother, matriarch of this world, birthed and devoured. It is failing. The web has become wicked, our language lost, and the songs are severed.
MTIStitch4: ^Mother Tree: Go, restore the language to our senses, follow the song and let it grow.

APStitch1: ^Mother Tree: This plant runs deep but not strong. It is drowsy and unaware of your presence, resting in a chemical slumber which it will soon be unable to rely upon, leaving the plant weak to the rising storm. You must awaken it.

COPStitch1: ^Mother Tree: What once fed us and let us grow tall, has make the soil an empty cosm. There is no space for others to sing with my child. The residuals still crowd this space.
COPStitch2: ^Plant: NO! Don’t cut me off, friend. I need my chemicals. I was born with them and I’ll die without them.
COPStitch3: ^Plant: Don’t take them away! You’re killing me! Mother Tree: Keep it up.
COPStitch4: ^Plant: I'm DONE! Wait, a vibration in the soil? Who’s whispering?
COPStitch6: ^I wish I could cry out and meet it… but how?
COPStitch7: ^Is it just me or do I want to MOVE!?

APStitch1: ^Mother Tree: Little sproutling, you are ready to sing again. Listen and teach them the microbial melody.
APStitch2: ^Plant: HELL YEAH I HAVE A VOICE.
APStitch3: ^What are these murmurs and mumbles. I like it.
APStitch4: ^Plant: I can hum, in this usually quiet void... and something else, an echo of a melodic memory.
APStitch5: ^Is it just me or do I want to MOVE!?
APStitch6: ^Mother tree: Be mindful of what you play, for who knows what it might conjure. Much lurks in the soil, friends, foe, and neither. This song can summon all…
APStitch7: ^Mother tree: Listen carefully to my song
APStitch8: ^Mother tree: Listen carefully, it goes like this 1aaa aaaaaa aa aaaa aa
APStitch9: ^Mother Tree: That’s it, you’ve sung in harmony. You've led these microbes home, I feel their excitement again

MSStitch1: ^Mother tree: That’s it, you’ve sung in harmony. You've led these microbes home, I feel their excitement again.
MSStitch2: ^Plant: Little ones, you bring a hidden taste to me. I feel... rejuvenated. How could I forget this feeling?
MSStitch4: ^Microbe: Come, come. We stay for trade.
MSStitch5: ^Microbe: Forgotten host, have a sip and show me your goods.
MSStitch6: ^Microbe: Refreshing exchange, your feed is fantastic. What can I do for you?
MSStitch7: ^Microbe: ONLY IF WE DON’T MAKE THE BEST CASE?
MSStitch8: ^Microbe: You forgot about us, and suckled from another. We are the makers of the world. We will always survive but your life is short without us.

FFStitch1: ^Mother Tree: Click on the fungi that have appeared
FFStitch2: ^Fungi: Hello For now, I am small but bring me enough food and I could enwrap the earth.
FFStitch3: ^Fungi: Sweet preserved decay, can you feel that? My tastebuds have been caressed once again. Let me unfold... and... reach.
FFStitch4: ^Mother tree: No one should be alone, bring company and cooperation to my child. Fill up their emptiness.
FFStitch5: ^What’s this? I feel a joy and song within me, and strength coursing through my cells. Bring me more, for they are bursting with energy.
FFStitch6: ^You forgot about us, and suckled from another. We are the makers of the world. We will always survive but your life is short without us. Feed us and we will bring you strength, good looks and resilience.
FFStitch7: ^No one is an individual but a thriving system of many. Few see this anymore.
FFStitch8: ^No one is an individual but a thriving system of many. Few see this anymore.
FFStitch9: ^Plant: My journey grows longer, but it’ll be a lonesome exploration by all accounts…

MTIStitch1: ^Mother tree: I can sense their new power. But they need more friends to survive and defend themselves. They no longer need to be alone. Plug them into the network, so they can hear and sing as one among many. Let them access….a greater awareness.
MTIStitch2: ^Root: I feel naked and weak, without any support. Who will guide me?
MTIStitch3: ^I am ready to entwine, and repair the severed ties.
MTIStitch4: ^Hold on to your roots, little one. Do you hear that humming murmur rustling through every fiber? That’s the world in waiting.
MTIStitch5: ^What are these beautiful words, these symphonies of species? Woah, what is this?  Links of the past, present, future. Messages and memories. Advise, warnings and friendship.
MTIStitch6: ^How I have missed this sweet embrace. Little sproutling, my tendrils can bring food from beyond your reach and ferry your voice across the cosmos. Let my entangled body shield you from harm.
MTIStitch7: ^My child, how proud you’ve made me. - The louder the song, the more we can suck smog from the sky. Bury it in our roots and the depths of the earth.
MTIStitch8: ^How I have missed this sweet embrace. Little sproutling, my tendrils can bring food from beyond your reach and ferry your voice across the cosmos. Let my entangled body shield you from harm.
MTIStitch9: ^As a community, we follow birth and death as one, living by each other. Across the web, I have felt roots burn, wither, and drown. The world is changing, to survive this we must be connected in multispecies harmony.
MTIStitch10: ^For the artificial streams that made us drowsy will become a sporadic splatter, and to thrive while still providing for the 1bipeds1, we must rekindle past knowledge and kinship.
MTIStitch11: ^How I have missed this sweet embrace. Little sproutling, my tendrils can bring food from beyond your reach and ferry your voice across the cosmos. Let my entangled body shield you from harm.
MTIStitch12: ^The song needs to cover us all, and thanks to you the quiet void has started to crack open. Take the lead and spread our song, allow it to flourish far and wide. Build soil and song as one.
